item.title: With limitations comes freedom.
item.description: index - source: [[Alexandre Dumas]] - fr: [[Nick Milo]] Dantes asks, “What would you not have accomplished if you had been free?‚Äù The wise Abbe replies, “Possibly nothing at all; the overflow of my brain would probably, in a state of freedom, have evaporated in a thousand follies. Captivity brings light to the treasures of the human intellect, just as compression is needed to explode gunpowder.
